definition: lingering fear/fear after the event/post-traumatic stress
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
lit. to fear the wolf in front and the tiger behind (idiom)/fig. to be full of needless fears/reds under the beds
pinyin: qian2 pa4 lang2 hou4 pa4 hu3

sentences.english: Lookingback now at the product I was formerly satisfied with, I actually cringe.
sentences.chinese: 現在看看那些我之前滿意的作品，我實際上感到後怕。

sentences.english: Occasionally I played some clever moves, but usually was thrilled afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾下出幾個好招，還經常後怕幾分。

sentences.english: He has such a panic fear after the traffic accident.
sentences.chinese: 車禍過後他感到一種莫名其妙的後怕。

sentences.english: Now, when I record this disaster, I still fear.
sentences.chinese: 現在當我回憶起那場災難的時候，還是很後怕的。

sentences.english: This evil reminding me of nine-live cats, you could never be sure of its death even it had got shot.
sentences.chinese: 而此也令我想起了有九條命的貓，擊斃後還會有後怕。

sentences.english: The girl was so frightened that he would fly away.
sentences.chinese: 女孩感到後怕它會飛離她的身邊。

sentences.english: For weeks I'd been so fearful of this moment.
sentences.chinese: 好幾個星期我都爲那一刻感到後怕。

sentences.english: The thought of it terrified me.
I can't talk about my driving test. The mere thought strikes terror into me.
sentences.chinese: 我不能談論我的駕駛測試，想一想都讓我後怕。

definition: to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
